name: Programmer CV
body:
### Gary Hess
github: @garbo999  
linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/pub/gary-hess/5/6b3/a88  
mobile: +49 0174 3447047  
location: freiburg, germany  
email: garyhess999@gmail.com

### TECHNICAL SKILLS
Ruby on Rails, Linux, Javascript, HTML5, MySQL

### PROJECTS

- [TabCode][Link 1]: Given a Javascript library without a formal API, I analyzed the code and repackaged it with some examples that I created. The goal was to make it possible for inexperienced users to display lute tablature on the web.

- [LaClaveciniste.Com][Link 3]: I was given the design for a small site and rebuilt it using Rails and Bootstrap. The main task here was to take a design created on a Macbook and rebuild the HTML in a sensible way with Bootstrap. In terms of Rails, the highlight is the internationalization (I18n) with support for two languages (Estonian and English).

- [Radiogetaway.Com][Link 4]: I created the design and built this site using Rails and Bootstrap. The site uses the Devise and Omniauth gems and it is deployed on Heroku.

- [Estonian Spidering Project][Link 5]: As part of my studies of the Estonian language, the goal of this project was to develop a Ruby class that would spider the linguistic website http://www.filosoft.ee/gene_et/ and save the data on the local server. Environment: Ruby on Rails. Main focus: MECHANIZE and PG_SEARCH gems.

- [Garage48 project][Link 2]: During this 48-hour startup weekend, I was the backend developer for the 1st place team. Working with a human trafficking expert from an NGO, we created an app that regularly spiders a website offering sexual services and allows his team to analyze the nature of the offered services. I have continued working on this project from time to time since September 2015.

- TRB4: I partnered with a friend in a startup in the translation industry in San Francisco. We initially hired an external company to code our webservice (a search engine for existing translations), then I took over the programming duties and rebuilt and finished the site (now defunct) using PHP and Oracle.

### EDUCATION

- BS Electrical Engineering from North Carolina State University: My degree included several programming courses such as data structures. I also worked for three semesters as a lab instructor in courses where the students wrote and  debugged programs for interfacing microcontrollers with various types of hardware. 

### RECENT ONLINE COURSES
- "Algorithms: Design and Analysis, Parts 1 and 2" from Coursera (Stanford University)
- "Software as a Service, Parts 1 and 2" from edX (University of California at Berkeley)
- "Learn HTML5 from W3C" from edX (W3C) (an excellent overview of the latest HTML standard)
- Multiple courses in Machine Learning from Coursera (Stanford and University of Washington)

[Link 1]: https://github.com/garbo999/TabCode
[Link 2]: http://garage48.org/blog/othe-winner-of-garage48-tip-will-disrupt-traffickers-by-scanning-online-ads
[Link 3]: http://www.laclaveciniste.com/en
[Link 4]: http://www.radiogetaway.com/
[Link 5]: https://ancient-hollows-2475.herokuapp.com/nounparents
